avalancheActivity.comment:
Since Sunday wind slabs formed in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation as well as at intermediate and high altitudes.
These can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
The older wind slabs are covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some new snow to low altitudes. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Faceted weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes.

tendency.comment: Strong northwesterly wind: The avalanche danger will not decrease for the time being.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Some snow fell on Sunday. Since Sunday the wind has been moderate to strong. In some localities small wind slabs formed. The more recent wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
Wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The new snow is lying on a crust. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Strong northwesterly wind: The avalanche danger will persist.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In these regions from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects a little snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: Hardly any snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes. The snowpack is stable and its surface has a resilient crust.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular above approximately 2400 m.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects in all altitude zones thus far only a little snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 2400 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At higher altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
